Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly experienced and strategic Head of Marketing to lead and drive the company&rsquo;s marketing vision within the construction industry.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and executing integrated marketing strategies that enhance brand visibility, generate qualified leads, support business development, and drive revenue growth across construction projects and services.

	Develop and implement comprehensive marketing strategies aligned with company growth objectives.
	Lead brand positioning and ensure consistent messaging across all marketing channels.

	Manage digital marketing initiatives including website, social media, email marketing, and online campaigns.
	Coordinate advertising, media planning, and promotional activities.
	Work closely with project, commercial, and bidding teams to develop compelling presentations, proposals, and marketing materials for tenders.

	Lead, mentor, and manage the marketing team and external agencies.
	Develop and manage the annual marketing budget, ensuring optimal ROI.
	Track KPIs, campaign performance, and marketing effectiveness.

	Minimum of 10 years of marketing experience, with significant experience in the construction industry
	MBA or professional marketing certification is an added advantage.
	Proven experience leading marketing strategy for construction projects, infrastructure, or real estate developments.
	Strong understanding of the construction market, procurement cycles, tenders, and project-based sales.
	Excellent leadership, strategic thinking, and decision-making skills.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Marketing

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

	We are seeking a highly experienced and strategic Head of Marketing to lead and drive the company’s marketing vision within the construction industry.

	Track KPIs, campaign performance, and marketing effectiveness.
	Collaborate with internal teams including construction, engineering, finance, and executive leadership.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, consultants, partners, and industry stakeholders.

	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field.
	Minimum of 10 years of marketing experience, with significant experience in the construction industry
	MBA or professional marketing certification is an added advantage.

	Excellent leadership, strategic thinking, and decision-making skills.

Our solutions encompass fiber-to-the-home (FTTH), fiber-to-the-business (FTTB), wireless broadband, and VSAT services, ensuring seamless internet access.

In addition to our core connectivity offerings, we provide comprehensive managed services, enabling businesses to optimize network performance, enhance security, and scale their digital operations efficiently. Backed by a team of seasoned specialists, as well as highly skilled engineers and technicians, LinkOrgNet is dedicated to delivering cutting-edge solutions that drive digital transformation and connectivity excellence.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Telecoms Rigger

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: RF Manager

Job Description


	The Telecoms Rigger at Linkorg Networks Limited will be responsible for installing, maintaining, and repairing telecommunications equipment on towers, rooftops, and other elevated structures.
	This role requires excellent climbing skills, a strong understanding of telecommunications systems, and a commitment to safety.


Key Responsibilities
Installation and Maintenance:


	Install, maintain, and repair telecommunications equipment, including wireless antennas, satellite dishes, and cabling, on towers and other elevated structures.
	Perform routine inspections and preventive maintenance to ensure optimal performance and safety of equipment.
	Install fiber optic cables and other structured cabling systems for telecommunications networks.
	Work with ground teams to set up and test equipment.


Safety and Compliance:


	Conduct safety checks and risk assessments before climbing and performing work at height.
	Adhere to all safety guidelines and regulations, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and fall protection gear
	Ensure all work complies with local, state, and federal regulations and industry standards.
	Troubleshooting and Repair:
	Diagnose and troubleshoot issues with telecommunications equipment and systems.
	Repair or replace faulty equipment and components as needed.
	Document and report any issues encountered and solutions implemented.


Collaboration and Communication:


	Work closely with other team members, including ground technicians, engineers, and customer service representatives.
	Provide clear and concise communication to team members regarding work progress and any issues encountered.
	Participate in training and development programs to stay current with industry trends and technologies.


Qualifications


	SSCE or equivalent. Technical training or certification in telecommunications, electrical, or a related field is preferred.
	Minimum of 2-3 years of experience working at heights, preferably in the telecommunications or construction industry.
	Experience with the installation and maintenance of telecommunications equipment is highly desirable.
	Experience with fiber cabling and splicing is highly desirable.
	Experience as a telecommunications rigger or related field.
	Proficiency in climbing and working at heights, with certification in tower climbing.
	Knowledge of rigging techniques, knots, and safety procedures specific to tower climbing.
	Proficiency in fiber cabling and splicing
	Understanding of telecommunications equipment and wireless antenna systems.
	Ability to use hand and power tools effectively.
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Physical fitness and ability to perform strenuous tasks at heights.
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
	Willingness to travel and work in various outdoor environments and weather conditions.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Certification in tower climbing and rescue (such as ComTrain or equivalent) is required.
	Additional certifications in telecommunications technology or safety are a plus.
	Valid driver&rsquo;s license and reliable transportation.


Work Environment:


	Ability to work in various environments, including outdoor locations and confined spaces.
	Physical ability to lift and carry equipment, climb ladders and towers, and perform other physically demanding tasks.
	Willingness to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, as needed.
	Ability to travel to various job sites as required.


Salary
N275,000 - N300,000 / month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume, cover letter to:&nbsp;recruit@linkorgnet.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;Telecoms Rigger&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

  "title": "Network Engineer",
  "description": "LinkOrgNet is a leading Internet Service Provider (ISP) committed to delivering high-speed, reliable connectivity to businesses and residential users. Our solutions encompass fiber-to-the-home (FTTH), fiber-to-the-business (FTTB), wireless broadband, and VSAT services, ensuring seamless internet access.

In addition to our core connectivity offerings, we provide comprehensive managed services, enabling businesses to optimize network performance, enhance security, and scale their digital operations efficiently. Backed by a team of seasoned specialists, as well as highly skilled engineers and technicians, LinkOrgNet is dedicated to delivering cutting-edge solutions that drive digital transformation and connectivity excellence.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Network Manager

Job Description


	The Network Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, maintaining, and troubleshooting network infrastructure to support the ISP&#39;s services.
	This role involves ensuring optimal network performance, scalability, and security.
	The Network Engineer collaborates with the NOC, operations, and customer service teams to deliver high-quality internet and data services to customers while maintaining the integrity of the network.


Responsibilities


	Ensure network designs are scalable and support current and future service demands.
	Work with vendors and service providers to integrate new technologies and systems.
	Monitor network performance and identify bottlenecks, failures, and other issues using tools such as SolarWinds, PRTG, or Zabbix.
	Conduct root cause analysis of network issues and implement corrective actions to prevent future occurrences.
	Troubleshoot network problems related to connectivity, latency, routing, switching, and traffic management.
	Conduct regular network audits and vulnerability assessments to maintain a secure network environment.
	Monitor network usage and plan for future capacity upgrades based on traffic growth and business needs.
	Ensure the network is resilient and redundant to minimize downtime and service interruptions.
	Provide technical support to other departments during the deployment of new services or systems.
	Maintain detailed documentation of network designs, configurations, incidents, and resolutions.
	Participate in proof-of-concept testing for new networking products and services.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or a related field.
	3-4 years of experience in network engineering, preferably within an ISP or telecommunications company.
	Relevant industry certifications such as CCNP, CCNA, or equivalent is highly desirable.
	Hands-on experience with routers, switches, firewalls, and other network equipment from vendors like Cisco, Juniper, and Huawei.
	Strong knowledge of IP protocols
	Strong expertise in routing protocols such as BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, and MPLS.
	Familiarity with network automation and scripting (e.g., Python, Bash) is a plus.
	Proficiency in using network monitoring and management tools like SolarWinds, Wireshark, or Zabbix, Netbox.


Salary
N400,000 - N450,000 / month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume, cover letter, and references to:&nbsp;recruit@linkorgnet.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;Network Engineer&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

Network Engineer Job at Linkorg Networks Limited




        
    

        
        LinkOrgNet is a leading Internet Service Provider (ISP) committed to delivering high-speed, reliable connectivity to businesses and residential users. Our solutions encompass fiber-to-the-home (FTTH), fiber-to-the-business (FTTB), wireless broadband, and VSAT services, ensuring seamless internet access.

In addition to our core connectivity offerings, we provide comprehensive managed services, enabling businesses to optimize network performance, enhance security, and scale their digital operations efficiently. Backed by a team of seasoned specialists, as well as highly skilled engineers and technicians, LinkOrgNet is dedicated to delivering cutting-edge solutions that drive digital transformation and connectivity excellence.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Engineer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Network Manager

Job Description


	The Network Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, maintaining, and troubleshooting network infrastructure to support the ISP's services.
	This role involves ensuring optimal network performance, scalability, and security.
	The Network Engineer collaborates with the NOC, operations, and customer service teams to deliver high-quality internet and data services to customers while maintaining the integrity of the network.


Responsibilities


	Ensure network designs are scalable and support current and future service demands.
	Work with vendors and service providers to integrate new technologies and systems.
	Monitor network performance and identify bottlenecks, failures, and other issues using tools such as SolarWinds, PRTG, or Zabbix.
	Conduct root cause analysis of network issues and implement corrective actions to prevent future occurrences.
	Troubleshoot network problems related to connectivity, latency, routing, switching, and traffic management.
	Conduct regular network audits and vulnerability assessments to maintain a secure network environment.
	Monitor network usage and plan for future capacity upgrades based on traffic growth and business needs.
	Ensure the network is resilient and redundant to minimize downtime and service interruptions.
	Provide technical support to other departments during the deployment of new services or systems.
	Maintain detailed documentation of network designs, configurations, incidents, and resolutions.
	Participate in proof-of-concept testing for new networking products and services.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or a related field.
	3-4 years of experience in network engineering, preferably within an ISP or telecommunications company.
	Relevant industry certifications such as CCNP, CCNA, or equivalent is highly desirable.
	Hands-on experience with routers, switches, firewalls, and other network equipment from vendors like Cisco, Juniper, and Huawei.
	Strong knowledge of IP protocols
	Strong expertise in routing protocols such as BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, and MPLS.
	Familiarity with network automation and scripting (e.g., Python, Bash) is a plus.
	Proficiency in using network monitoring and management tools like SolarWinds, Wireshark, or Zabbix, Netbox.


Salary
N400,000 - N450,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume, cover letter, and references to: recruit@linkorgnet.com using “Network Engineer” as the subject of the email.
